website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for light work from a recognized brand, but it doesn't rise to the level of some other high-end saws.
pros: A battery-powered saw that is light and easy to assemble
The batteries hold a charge well and provide ample power
cons: A loud saw that is best suited for light pruning work

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful electric pole saw that will cut your tree pruning time in half.
pros: Breaks down into 3 pieces for compact storage
Easily cuts through branches with minimal effort
Saw automatically stops if the chain comes off or the pole becomes unscrewed
cons: The cutting edge is heavier than the base, so it can be a little difficult to balance
Must be periodically oiled by hand

customer_reviews.title: The bolts themselves are in great shape and do not appear stripped/threaded
customer_reviews.text: After 2nd season of usage, no longer usable. The 2 bolts which hold the plastic guard to the housing no longer tighten. The bolts themselves are in great shape and do not appear stripped/threaded. The Bar will no longer tighten in this state and the tool is now useless. I have contact Black and Decker for warranty repair and may update my rating if they resolve the product issue. The plastic guard and these bolts are very flimsy and will surely be a failure point for many others. *Update. Black and Decker warranty replaced the saw once I took it in person to an authorized repair shop. I have not put it to use since.
customer_reviews.author: Ultravylence

customer_reviews.title: Breaks often... trajectory toward catastrophic failure
customer_reviews.text: The saw pulls limbs under the plastic face. The faceplate can dislodge which which make the chain fall off and the item useless. I spent ten minutes repairing and putting the chain back on for every one minute I spent cutting. This is very frustrating. Further the plastic faceplate is now damaged and was getting worse the more I used it. This is after about 45 minutes of cutting. It was headed toward failure. I am looking for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: C Boone

customer_reviews.title: I had only cut 8 small limbs, 1 to 2 inches in diameter before is died on me.
customer_reviews.text: This saw stopped working after 20 mins of use. I had only cut 8 small limbs, 1 to 2 inches in diameter before is died on me. - The saw had the proper chain tension. - The bar/chain was lubed every ten mins, per user instructions. - I tried disconnecting and reconnecting everything, hoping some internal fault switch had tripped. - I ensured the battery was fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.....recommended
customer_reviews.text: The minute we got this I sat down and started reading the instruction manual, which was pretty simple to follow. Today we did some serious damage to some trees and bushes. With the extra extension making it 9 foot, it was a little heavy for us to operate (both of us are over 65), so we just stuck to using without the extension. The manual talked about a kick back, but neither of us experienced any of that. The battery took just a little over 3 hours to fully charge. Would recommend this for anyone with light tree trimming to do.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Plahn

customer_reviews.title: Good cutting, short battery life, long charge time
customer_reviews.text: The saw works great when the battery is charged. I was able to cut large limbs down and further process the branches into manageable sections. The battery only lasted about 1/2 hour of cutting. I have two batteries, and they take a few hours to fully charge. If you do not fully charge the batteries and try using them after an hour of charging, you will only get another minute or two of cutting. This purchase was a good compliment to the black and decker yard trimmer I already had and love. I would have purchased a corded trimmer had I known how short lived the battery would be for use with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: JJSIV

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I am 72 years old and can’t get a regular chain saw going. I feel quite comfortable using this saw. Do order bigger batteries as the one that comes with it does not run long. At my age when battery gives out so do I. LOL The covering for the blade needs some way to keep it on. Wants to slide off when hung up. The too for changing blade could be better designed also. I recommend this for trimming limbs and bushes. Love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 1 year. It did work fine for the first year I had it, but when I brought it out this summer to do some light trimming, nothing. I have so many of these B&D batteries, I can say without a doubt it's the saw and the batteries are great. If I didn't need a reason to leave this under powered 20V ecosystem already, this just forced me out of it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The saw worked wonderful when it worked
customer_reviews.text: The saw worked wonderful when it worked. I ordered my first one April 2017. Sadly I used it for about 20 minutes before it quit. I returned it for a new one which I used once in May 2017. I got it out today to use it and it worked for about 10 minuted before it quit again for good. I've read directions and maintained it as instructed - still crapped out after a couple uses. Worked when it worked, but that was not long. I really wanted to like it!
customer_reviews.author: David Lusher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work great
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this because I have a B&D Trimmer and already had the battery and charger. It sometimes doesn’t want to cut unless you have it positioned just right. Twigs frequently get caught up in the chain and you have to take the cover off and unclog it. It’ll cut limbs up to 2 inches in diameter but doesn’t work well on very small limbs less than 3/4 inch. If you have a small yard then it’s fine. If you have a larger yard you will become frustrated often.
customer_reviews.author: ADS

customer_reviews.title: Best yard maintenance tool in my shed.
customer_reviews.text: A must have yard maintenance item. Works just like it is advertised (for once). Only had this saw for about a month and I have lost count of how many tree limbs fell to this beast. You really need the big 4.0 battery to rotate with the small one that comes with this unit. This tool works so well, I have worn down before the two batteries have. 3 to 6 inch limbs are handled easily. Keep check on the chain tension and oil the chain every battery change like the directions read. Would recommend to anyone with a lot of trees on their land.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap poke saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw works great for small branches. Make sure you’re cutting at the right angle or it could get stuck by the falling branch. It needs a lot of adjustments during use. After every 15 minutes of use, check the blade and chain tightness. As it heats, it becomes looser which will get the blade stuck. The pole unfortunately is very flimsy and will “bounce” in the air back and forth if shaken. As a currently pregnant woman who does her own property maintenance, that makes me quite nervous about durability. Will update about durability after having it for longer!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Already had B&D 20V battery, so bought bare tool. Cuts 4" limb easy, just don't force it. I had a citrus tree, several 2" thick bushes, and a dead stump of at least 4". Did all on single charge of 4 amp batt. Quite top-heavy even w/o extension - just takes getting used to. Auto oiler would be nice, otherwise exactly what I expected. Comes with chain already installed. Just plug together, oil it up and attack them trees.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart first use, then died not long after
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this thing, the screws holding the chain guide loosened up and one fell out and was lost. Black+Decker replaced them, and I could start using the saw again. A couple of weeks later, the saw stopped while using it, I thought it was due to a dead battery. I tried 4 fully charged batteries, and the saw did nothing. No noise, no attempt to work, nothing. After 34 days owning this saw, it was dead. It's a shame, the saw worked great when it was working. But, I will not be replacing this saw with another Black+Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Tree Trimming a Breeze
customer_reviews.text: We have a two-acre lot with numerous trees that require occasional trimming. So far, this pole saw has done the job. Much easier to use than my old manual trimmer. I have two other 20-volt battery-operated Black & Decker tools, (a drill and a garden tiller), so I just swap batteries between the three of them. Because the pole saw is only used in short spurts, I have never run out of "juice." Easy to use but be sure to follow all of the safety instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Mani2

customer_reviews.title: This pole saw is awesome! I cut down a large section of a ...
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is awesome! I cut down a large section of a birch tree and a pine tree in 1 use. I followed the instructions and oiled the chain (bar and chain oil not included) however a nice small carrying bottle is included which i filled for future use. Also the allen wrench is included in the chain guard to use to tighten / loosen the chain. I have used many manual pole saws over the years and I wish i found this saw sooner. Also the black and decker battery is compatible with my other black and decker battery operated tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works well, top heavy, small battery
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very handy for cutting branches quickly. It is a little top heavy, so it isn't always easy to hold the saw exactly where you want it. This is especially true if trying to cut under the branch prior to cutting above it for a clean cut. The battery that comes with it is very small and doesn't have much power in it - I had a weed cutter from BD that came with an identical battery but with twice the capacity - it worked fine and was completely compatible...Other than that, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: DrDan

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Tool
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today and overall was very pleased with it. I cut a good 4"-5" branch fairly easily, but tried not to push it to work harder than it should. It's a good buy for the money, but be gentle with it, making sure you oil the chain constantly, and tightening it regularly, again, gently. It is clearly not designed for major cutting projects, but rather smaller branches. If you keep these tips in mind, you will find it a very practical tool. It sure saved me a lot of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: L. Berrios

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast. Works well so far. I do know the batteries get old fast and my previous one of these died quickly. Still replaced it with the same one though as the last one did do the job well until we killed it so I feel like we got our money's worth from it. For the amount I use it and type of job, I should prob buy a gas one but I prefer dealing with the batteries rather than gas. It makes good light work or reasonably thick branches. Perfectly adequate for your average home owner.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Del Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and a Big Headache to return
customer_reviews.text: This saw has a real problem with the chain. It will pop out every time you want to make a cut. Adjusted it several times, always the same problem despite plenty of oil and constant adjusting checking. Big headache also to return this item. You can not return directly to Black and Decker. It will go to a local distributor who will refund in 3-4 weeks, if you are lucky. That is a quote from the distributor (who was very informative and kind). So there you go. If you want an inferior product and a pain to return, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Batesole

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Took down a Cyprus with basically just this little guy. Cuts great. Chain came off however it is super easy to put back on, no fuss. Shoot I did it on the roof haha. Make sure to keep it lubed up. Only gripe, I wish the poles were made of a strong material. When you are falling a tree from a roof the play it has at two extensions is extreme, wouldn't want to imagine three. Otherwise no gripes. 5 out of 5 stars for sure. Btw, I have a few B&D tools, definitely worth it to buy a few extra batteries and speed charger.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Trimmed neighbors tree growing over and smothering my tree. Maybe a little hard to handle extended fully. I am a 70 year old with balance issues even I mangaded. I used the extension for my BD pole trimmer, that does not come with an extra extension. There is a slight modification that need be done. Grind off the ridge on the extension that only fits the saw. The trigger handles are the same, you will have two triggers. One with the extention and one without.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Eventually, after you solve all of life's problems, you realize the low hanging limbs are bothering you. That is when you start shopping for a pole saw. This one works well and has enough power to get the job done. I have Ryobi and B&D cordless tools. I went with B&D due to cost. I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: MCN

customer_reviews.title: Chain kept coming off
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible. I spent more time putting the chain back on that actually cutting anything. I was only able to use it a few times but again, during that time the chain would keep coming off. Eventually the chain dug into the blade (track) and now it's worthless. Seriously, I never write bad reviews but this has me angry that I wasted my money and soooo much time.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ...
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy so it's easy to lift up to reach high limbs. I used this to cut off limbs on fruit trees, pine trees, cedar trees, and maples. It worked like a champ. I even cut a couple four inch fir tree stocks that had died (not recommended but I didn't want to stop and get my chainsaw). I cut many limbs (lost count) and the battery had life left. Wear gloves while using this, be sure to check the chain tension periodically (easily adjusted with the included tool), and oil the chain before each use. Highly recommend this limb cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johns

customer_reviews.title: I expect to get a lot of use out of this remarkable tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking down some large limbs off of some dead trees in my front yard and have been using this tool extensively. I like that you can just lay the chain on the limb you want down and it will chew its way through it without any pressure from me. I oil the chain with peanut oil I pour off my pure peanut butter (and replace with MCT oil when I eat the peanut butter) but any light oil will do fine. I expect to get a lot of use out of this remarkable tool.
customer_reviews.author: El sie Nicohls

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but After using this for a bit
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and intended. Works great, but After using this for a bit, it could improve in the following ways: 1) B&D needs to provide a leakproof oil bottle for the bar oil. 2) The bar will occasionally work loose and the chain will slip off... but this is fairly common for chain saws of any type - so keep the provided allen wrench handy. 3) A design modification could easily be made to allow a connection point just behind the motor and cutter head - as is, the minimum reach length is over 6 feet. This simple modification would greatly improve short range usability for low branches.
customer_reviews.author: IGLASS

customer_reviews.title: Make yardwork fun again!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy & fool-proof. The keyway connections made adding extension seamless. Chain came installed & tight. Lightweight, my arms weren't fatigued after moderate tree trimming Applied liberal amt. of SAE30 motor oil, used Saw for 40 min. w/o reapplying; still lubricated. Cuts like butter with very little effort on my part, no binding. Happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: erica

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a pro.
customer_reviews.text: I have given this thing a work out since I got it and I've gotten one also. Cuts like a pro. Keep the chain oiled and sharp and it's good to go. Got an extra battery as back-up, they last a while but charging with the included charger is very slow. Only thing I would say needs improved is stability when the middle extension is added on but it still works well. Other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: HES

customer_reviews.title: which were invaluable for continued use over about five hours of use--some of the larger amp hour batteries would be a good choi
customer_reviews.text: I had several other B&D 20V tools, and was facing a major pruning job on numerous trees--this was an obvious choice, especially for the money. I happened to have 4 batteries for the various tools, which were invaluable for continued use over about five hours of use--some of the larger amp hour batteries would be a good choice. This is well built, relatively light, and effortless to use--I'm still quite surprised how well and fast the saw cuts--don't need to force it, just let the saw do all the work. Highly recommended. My shoulders are quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Save your neck & shoulders when trimming trees
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is excellent. No more repetitions pulling &pushing a hand powered pole saw. I have used it to trim trees that hit me in the head when mowing the edges of my property. It is light weight and cuts well. It needs to be hand oiled every 10 or 15 minutes of use but that is minor. So far I have never been able to run down the battery. Just case I have the regular chain saw that uses the same battery so I always have one charged & ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Wm F. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I opted for this because it's lighter in weight and obviously easier to start, but the pole is wobbly when you're lifting it and cutting with it, the saw on the end is almost too heavy for the pole. I would recommend a lightweight aluminum and a solid section pole, not segments you put together. It does work, it does do the job, but be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker pole saw cordless 20V
customer_reviews.text: The chain came off after the first use. Had to put it back on and retighen. Not a big deal but you'll think it would have been perfect the first time out. Used it some more after that and chain never came off. Cuts well but the longer the pole the more force you'll have to use to hold down. The chain will pole saw will just bounce around. Great battery life and pretty light if your not using the extension. Just keep in mind the longer away from your cut the heavier and harder it'll be to control.
customer_reviews.author: honestandtrue

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Branch Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works very well. It makes taking care of branches incredibly easy. It is much easier than manual branch trimmers. Battery life was solid, with an added bonus that it uses the same 20v battery as my drill, string trimmer, and small leaf blower. Overall I’m very happy. It helped with a trimming project I’d been putting off for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw on a stick is simply fantastic! One charge lasted plenty long enough to get all of our trimming done. It took is 3 times longer to pick up the trimmings than to do the trimming. We trimmed larger branches as well as smaller. You need to tighten the chain after a couple of branches, but once you do that, it’s no issue. You have to oil the chain, but one oiling at the beginning lasted thru the entire charge.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug Crossing

customer_reviews.title: I Was Going To Send It Back!  BUT WAIT!!!!...
customer_reviews.text: First time I took it out to use the battery went dead after about 5 minutes! I couldn't believe it! I had charged it for about 4 hours. I only cut 3 2" branches of a tree in the yard. I was really disgusted! Set it back on the charger overnight, and much to my surprise it worked like a champ. Used it for about 45 minutes, cutting apple tree, evergreen, and maple tree branches. I would now buy it again and am a happy camper!!!
customer_reviews.author: Theodore P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw
customer_reviews.text: It is great for small trunks and branches up to 6 inches around. The maintenance and upkeep is easy. The oil must be kept up to speed after about fifteen minutes. The battery is good for that long under heavy use. The blade is small and the saw is a bit cumbersome when used at it's maximum extension. It will do the small jobs with good results.
customer_reviews.author: Neil OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Best price for a B&D cordless pole saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw works well and has decent battery life. As with most pole saws they are a bit awkward to maneuver when fully extended. The extensions on this saw screw together and are only adjustable by removing or adding the extension. The blade is only a little over 8 inches long so you have a little less cutting ability but on most branches it works well and cuts very good.
customer_reviews.author: PM in UT

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: this saw does the job I wanted done. The battery was still going when I had trimmed enough to fill the pickup. Most of my cuts were about 1 " in diameter but a couple 5" branches. It is very different from using a gas saw. It turns at a much slower RPM. The motor is at the head end. That makes it much heavier to hold and blocks the view of the cut. Manual oiling is no problem but was a little messy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shaker

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for an electric pole saw.
customer_reviews.text: With several trees in the yard, I have an ongoing need to prune high above my normal reach. This little pole saw does a good job of it. I already had several B&D tools that use the same battery, so it was an obvious choice. I really like not having to mess with gasoline and all the maintenance issues that come with it. Don't forget to buy some chainsaw bar oil, that's the best way to prolong the life.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf223

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used it much but it seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much but it seems to be very well made. Has a quality feel to it. The shaft feels a bit flimsy when you put pressure on it to get thru a limb. Has quite a bit of power and torque for a cordless tool. I wish you could attach the handle directly to the saw without the short shaft between the 2. Would make it so much handier to cut up felled branches. Also see my review on the matching 20v weed wacker.
customer_reviews.author: farkus

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price I guess. It is not very durable and has a short battery life. It will only cut for about 10 minutes before needing recharged. There is no automatic oiling. They send you a little plastic oiler bottle and tell you to oil the chain between charges. So if you are in a hurry to get your work done, don't buy this item. If you can take your time, like me, it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: Saved the tree and the house with a trim
customer_reviews.text: The pole saw did a fine job trimming the tree in my front yard. High winds were forecast for our area and the tree had a lot of leaves that I expected would act as a sail and the strong wind may push the tree over on the house. Trim completed strong wind came and went the tree is still upright. Just exactly what was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Nail

customer_reviews.title: Fun little saw
customer_reviews.text: Black and Decker is more of a budget brand, so you can't expect a ton from a $80 pole saw. It is not self oiling which is fine for seldom usage. It's brushed motor offers a decent runtime and enough power for light jobs. I like that the sheath also stores your scwrench and a small oil bottle. It works well enough to keep some branches from growing over the cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great reach... and great safety features...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool... not only does it have nifty safety features, but it has such a long reach with the extension that I might never need anything longer to trim tree branches to a reasonable height. This is one of the more used B&D battery tools that we have purchased as it seems that low hanging tree limbs happen too often? I recommend it if you have tree limb problems and need an easy solution. Like all B&D battery-powered tools -> Get the fast charger!
customer_reviews.author: OhioAwesome

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool—a lot. If it broke, I’d buy another one right away. Easy to use, long, powerful. I’ve cut some big limbs with it without much trouble. I even use it to cut medium-sized logs when I don’t feel like using the gas powered chainsaw. It’s nice and safe since I’m far away from the blade. Great price. I really don’t have anything bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: 5'4" girl loves this!!
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to use! I had a lot of trees to trim so just fair warning, the weight of the saw gets heavier and heavier as time goes on haha. The battery matches my 20v B&D drill/hand saw set so I was able to take it straight from the box to my yard. I spent over an hour cutting down branches. Big (as in like 2-3" diameter) and small ones (the smaller the harder almost)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power in this pole saw
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is the latest addition to my collection of Black & Decker 20 volt tools. I find that the 20 volt batteries have enough power to handle most any (reasonable) job I can throw at them. By having more than one battery I can double or triple my work time by swapping them out as they run down. This pole say is convenient to use and has a good reach. I was surprised by the amount of cutting power it has. I cut through a 10 inch white oak limb with this! Keep the chain sharp and lubricated and this will handle any pruning job you may have.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Bittinger

customer_reviews.title: Not for general use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, tried it out on 1/2 inch to 1.5 inch branches of different trees. Pecan,juniper, and finally a bradford pear. I simply could not get it to cut these woods. The design is solid, good to hold, but it cannot bring any cutting power to these branches. It took 10 min of hard work to cut the bradford pear which is not a particularly hard wood. Sorry, but not the product for us.
customer_reviews.author: F. Dorsey McBride

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointment. The tool lacks the power needed to cut. The chain should have been a .325 not 3/8 pitch, the battery should have been 40 volt, and there should have been an oiler built in. I also own B&D hedge trimmer which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: We have other B&D battery powered lawn tools and love that the batteries are interchangeable. My husband cut some limbs ranging from .5”-5” with ease. He used it for about 40 minutes and still had battery left. He had it fully telescoped and said it was awkward to use so he made it shorter and used a ladder for the taller branches. We’re very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: MommaLazer

customer_reviews.title: Does a lot of work.
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts for about 30-40 min. I did all this with one, even cut up the downed branches as well. Had some life left. Light, sharp, as maneuverable as can be expected for a long pole. Follow up from previous. After a good amount of use, I tightened the chain. Then went after a tree that had branches growing down to ground level. 2.5 batteries for the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence C. Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Great for price if it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Chain retention is cheap and flimsy weakpoint with too much plastic in the wrong places... but for the money it seems to work well. Wish to see aluminum or steel in places instead. If the battery lasts more than 2 years it will be a great buy, time will tell. Quiet and cuts very well and quick, wiah you could use it without having to use first extension but thats nitpicking for price. Better then same size plug in electric chainsaw I bought from harbour freight.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Even better than expected...................I had thought of a cordless chainsaw; but when I saw this cordless pole chainsaw - and how I can use my B&D 20Volt batteries from other B&D products, that even made it a better choice. nice quality, nice full cover over chain/bar, and an extension that I've yet to need. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent light duty, battery pole saw
customer_reviews.text: I've used a variety of 'chain saws on a stick' . For the most part, the ergonomics/weight balance of these extension saws is terrible. In the case of of the B&D saw, you don't need arms like Popeye to use the saw fully extended for reasonable periods of time. Battery life seems more than adequate. The ability to significantly alter the pole length is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Rock of Ages

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit for the price. Realizing the limited power when I purchased it, I found that it fits my needs well. I lop branches that I can't reach, or that are too large for loppers. I'm using the charger that came with my hedge trimmer and it is slow to replenish the charge. I also purchased a 4.0 Ah 20V battery pack as my primary power.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got it and put it straight to work on a ton of trees at a new house I purchased. The battery lasted a lot longer then I thought it would. It was able to cut some pretty thick branches(oak, fruit trees, pine). Very happy with the purchase. Very pleased with the quality. And the same batteries work for my other black+Decker power tools I have.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Handy light duty tool. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Could use bigger battery. Works great because i understand this is a LIGHT DUTY TOOL! its great for those few limbs up high that you needs to clear from your roof! Its NOT a tool for professional landscaping. But to have something that reaches high and zings off some 2 to 4 inch branches without having to climb a tall ladder...yes, handy!
customer_reviews.author: Superrunner48

customer_reviews.title: Hand for a short girl. 😁
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our yard equipment. I can trim up the trees at my parents property with ease and this breaks down and storage is great. Would love it if a bag, storage/travel bag was included. That would help keep this tidy. My boyfriend suggested a gun case, because it’s the right size. I’m not to keen on that idea. Just because I don’t need the hassle of someone freaking out thinking it is a gun and not power tools. 🤦‍♀️🤪
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great line of tools!
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest... I've never been a fan of cordless yard equipment since it never seemed to have any power or keep a charge long enough to actually do anything. I decided to give this Black + Decker stuff a shot and picked up the hedge trimmer. WOW! I was so impressed, I ended up buying 4 different tools in the series. This pole saw is a life saver if you have trees or tall hedges that need trimming on a regular basis. The extension gives you all the reach you need. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: El Polacko

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing so far. It gets the job done well. I use it for many palm trees to cut the seed pods and their covers which are hard to cut with a standard pole saw (manual). Saves me time and energy. The only reason I deducted a star is that the replacement poles are absurdly over priced compared to the saw itself and the batteries are also expensive. This seems to be a loss-leader product; they get you in for cheap but the replacement parts are where they make their higher profit margins.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon O.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month of use. Black &Decker CstSvc isn't responding at all.
customer_reviews.text: The saw stopped working after approx 5 weeks after receipt. Black and Decker CstSvc isn't responding I couldn't get Cust Svc line to answer and filed a claim on line about 3 weeks ago... And still no one has contacted me from Black and Decker by email or phone. I have a Claim#. Hoping Amazon can offer some assistance....
customer_reviews.author: robred99

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Balance
customer_reviews.text: The saw is best used for close cuts in difficult to access areas but a challenge and performs better when cutting hardwood. Great without the extension but hard to maintain position, otherwise. It's top heavy. Good battery life and the batteries are the same as my string trimmer and drill - in case I need more time. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted this to cut branches that grow like weed here in Florida. With both extensions, it was to much for her. So I ended up with it. It is thirsty on batteries, but does the job . Some time when you want to do something right now and you don't want to have to work on a gas motor, it fits the bill perfect!
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the greatest pole saw out there, but it's great for occasional use. I use it mostly on small branches and trimming palm trees. It's easy to put together and use. However, the trigger occasionally gets stuck and the saw doesn't turn off, which is concerning regarding safety. It would be nice if it had an oil reservoir, but since it doesn't you have to remember to oil the chain periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Petitewboobs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small landscape jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pole saw for trimming small branches. Don't force the saw just lay it on the branch and with minimal pressure it does the job. The small battery is ok but I ordered the set with the larger battery for longer lasting umph without having to recharge. Black+Decker are great tools for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that good.
customer_reviews.text: I already own and frequently use the B&D pole trimmer which I like even though it has it's limitations.The pole chainsaw I ordered was very disappointing because the chain kept coming off and just took too long for me, cutting through bush and tree limbs. I returned the item as it was so ridiculous having to stop and replace the chain then adjust to make sure tension was good.
customer_reviews.author: Solar

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed.  Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I use a LOT of Black & Decker tools. First time I have been unhappy with one. Too much 'flex' in the pole. Bounces around too much. DANGEROUS! Chain would not stay tensioned. Had to reset/tighten between every 1/2 inch branch. Could not get through trimming one small tree before the new battery was dead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for getting to those branches up high. But if you hold out to your side at about a 45 degree angle it feels like it weighs 40 Lbs. I was 1/2 way up my 12 ft ladder and reaching over the fence to cut a branch. It cut right throw it BUT you better hang on because the weight will pull you off the ladder. I love B&D power tool and I have never used a pole saw so I would guess any of the pole saws would feel the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: I have a blue spruce dripping sap on a Trex staircase leading down to the lower level of the yard. If something like this wasn’t available I would have to call a tree trimmer at considerable expense. The offending branches are gone and the railings no longer have sap dripping on them. The chain did come off during the process but I put it back on and it hasn’t come off again.
customer_reviews.author: AK Harmon

customer_reviews.title: For a DC chainsaw on a stick it's very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't too hopeful when I ordered this but I have to say I am beyond impressed. The battery life isn't that great but that's my fault for buying the cheap ones. The cutting power on the other hand is impressive and doesn't slow down as the battery drains. When depleted it just stops but until then it rips right through everything I've tried including logs that were way over the 6" they recommend. Very solid purchase and I feel like I got my money's worth
customer_reviews.author: R Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to.....
customer_reviews.text: Used this right away and so far no issues. Just keep the chain oiled and snug and cut away! I keep 2 batteries, one in use and one in the charger....no down time. The portability makes it easy to just go to work - plug-n-play! After 3 days of pruning it has already paid for itself....
customer_reviews.author: J. N. Sublett

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this saw in October 2018 but kept it in the box until I had a chance to use it in April 2019. I made maybe 6 cuts on small 1 to 1/2 inch limbs. I the tension was correct and the chain was oiled. The chain came off and it took forever to get it back on. Now the chain won't tighten enough. I am ordering another chain but have my doubts. I have several BD tools that use the same battery so I thought this would be a great addition.......not so. So dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The pole felt kind of loose when cutting even when it was tightened but other than that it's been great. I think the largest diameter we used this on was 6" and it worked great. I do wish the battery lasted longer though. If you're doing a decent amount of work I suggest going ahead and buying a replacement blade with this thing just so you don't have to wait to finish your yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs higher output battery
customer_reviews.text: Update: after getting a 4.0Ah battery, the saw meets expectations. I'm able to walk around the property and trim limbs that are hanging over the yard. The saw does everything I wanted it for and I'm happy with it's performance. 15-20 minutes worth of battery and you're done... unless you have more than one battery. I hate that we wasted our money on this. I only cut 10 limbs varying from 1-3" and the battery was dead. I wouldn't recommend this pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: Small limbs around the house
customer_reviews.text: Great product for home use. I have an electric pole saw, which served me well for many years from the same manufacturer. However this is light and easy to work with because of no cord. After cutting those hard to reach limbs, take out the center extension and you can easily cut the small limbs for residential trash cans. You will have to get a spray/pump applicator for the chain oil to ensure the chain is lubricated appropriately, but I would rather do it manually than rely on an internal chamber to lube the chain anyways. The battery is small and charges quickly. One charge and I am able to work around the house for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mako

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded my expectations. Used to clear overgrown branches touching my house. Noticed that the squirrel were spending quite a lot of time on my roof. Powered through the job so much faster than expected. Battery has pretty good life, but am glad I picked up a second battery at the same time. Totally worth the extra $35. In truth, I have no complaints. I have no doubt that this will last for some time. At a 1/3 of the cost of a comparable unit, makes this a solid purchase. My only regret is that I did not buy one of these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Swiss

customer_reviews.title: Let the tool do the work.  Don't try to reach out to cut, use directly overhead
customer_reviews.text: The product worked as advertised. I used the saw to trim some overhead limbs. Because of the weight of the chain end, it is important to remember not to reach out to cut, but rather try to cut directly overhead.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Paden

customer_reviews.title: Like I often do
customer_reviews.text: I am still getting use to it. Like I often do, I starting using it without thoroughly reading the manual. The chain came off its track and I was able to get back on. I also need to lubricate the change as recommended in the instructions. While not too heavy, it is tiring holding they way I did initially so I am in learning curve. I am senior citizen so it may be that I am not working out enough.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos from FL

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.  Gets it done fast and fairly easy.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. Cutting small branches about 4" or less. No mixing gas, smell or load noise. Two sizes, because you can remove one of the 3 sections. Battery will not last too long. In my short experience I'd say about 30-40 branches. A bit on the heavy side but not a problem to just lean the blade on the branch. I bought the extra warranty for just a few dollars, so I know it will last at least 4 yrs. for me.
customer_reviews.author: Planner27

customer_reviews.title: Give a better battery
customer_reviews.text: The pole saw is really great. I have been able to trim trees that normally would have been out of reach. The only gripe I have is the battery does not cut as many limbs as it claims. Today I decided to count the branches I cut, for a total of 115. Keep in mind some were twigs and all were pine tree limbs. I really like the saw and it does a great job. You would think Black and Decker would give a better battery with their product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J Mallory

customer_reviews.title: 7 hours to charge for 5 minutes of cut time  . also fell apart after one day of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black and decker pole saw for clearing small trees after purchasing their electric weed eater and loving it . the saw is not even remotely in the same league . 20v battery vs 40v on the weed eater . the charge doesn't last and it takes forever to charge . after one day of use the wires came loose where the extenders connect and now I cannot use the middle extender at all. a very shoddy product to say the least .
customer_reviews.author: ronin0101

customer_reviews.title: about what I expected good price point
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those harbor freight pole saws need something that was more maneuverable. I have several black and Decker power packs and chargers. Now I have more. it cleaned up the tree and it is easy to use. just a little heavy for an old man. But easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo n tucson

customer_reviews.title: Tired of the ladder
customer_reviews.text: Had to trim a number of branches hanging over the roof. Decided part way through (and after moving the ladder dozens of times) that there had to be something easier. This was fantastic. Was able to trim and pull branches down. A hard hat really protected against branches that popped back on me.
customer_reviews.author: SjohnsonSP

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR THE GUY WHO HAS EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: My Guy purchases everything he desires, which makes it hard to come up with Birthday Gifts Etc. When we were at one of the big box stores recently, he was looking at/for this item. I jumped on Amazon as soon as I got home & purchased this for his July Birthday, and gave him his Early Birthday Gift. He is Extremely Pleased with this Pole Saw and has used it several times, trimming saplings and trees along his roadside fields.
customer_reviews.author: Irish One

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, flimsy pole.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, has a lot of power. The poles are a bit weak and flimsy. Went through a 5 inch branch that fell on the pole as they both were coming down and broke the middle extension pole. So I'm stuck using it in the 6ft configuration after only about 15 minutes of use. Still, for the money it's pretty good. New replacement pole will cost me in the low to mid 20's, so not too bad a hit. Still though, fully extended to about 10', this really felt bendy and flimsy. I would prefer a more solid feel.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Sigh.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, had high hopes for this. Made sure chain was at proper tension and was properly oiled. Managed to cut through 4 branches before the chain came off. Attached again and cut through 2 small branches before it came off again. Aside from that it's pretty heavy when using the top end of the extension and the blade was pretty dull. As bad as my back is I'm going back to manual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A truly amazing tool. I cut 5 and 6 inch pine ...
customer_reviews.text: A truly amazing tool. I cut 5 and 6 inch pine limbs and some 4 inch hardwood. I highly recommend getting the BLACK+DECKER L2ACF-OPE 20V MAX Lithium Ion Fast...Charger. In 40 minutes it will recharge the battery. If you do not choose to get the charger I recommend the larger optional battery. The supplied battery will last 15 to 20 minutes of cutting which is quite a lot considering the small battery. The supplied charger requires 8 hours or longer to recharge. I opted for the supplied battery and fast charger. I had a lot of triming to do and when the battery ran down by the time I cleaned up the limbs the battery was ready to go again.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Good with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pole saw over the summer numerous times Pros: - It works - Good battery life - Works well with small to medium branches. Palm fawns and various yard debris. Cons: - You need to manually oil the chain from time to time. There is no reservoir - Pole should be more rigid, there is way too much give - Balance could be better, or an additional handle in the middle piece would help steady the fully extended saw.
customer_reviews.author: DHO

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to switch from gas?
customer_reviews.text: I really like the battery ease of use and can spend time cutting limbs instead of trying to start a gas version.Saved over $500 by doing my own trimming instead of hiring a tree service. The only thing I would like is one more section of the extension so I could reach a little higher.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 star only because it is very nice for cutting branches higher up, and brush that's hard to reach. But, the battery sucks! My husband gets 45 minutes max and today he only got 35 minutes. And, that's after a full charge. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cree Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easy to operate and does an incredible ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to operate and does an incredible job at cutting. Hard to believe that I get this performance from a battery operated tool. Just a follow-up update. It's Oct 2019 and the unit is still working perfectly. I have not changed the chain. I did order an additional battery as a back up and one finally died several months ago. I live in South Florida and have used it after each Hurricane since purchase. a great homeowners tool for small cutting up to 4 inches.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: ... saw for a year now and have had very good results. I have three full size chain saws ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this saw for a year now and have had very good results. I have three full size chain saws with up to 22 inch bars, but this saw is perfect for reaching small to medium limbs without climbing a ladder and holding a heavy saw, not to mention the effort starting a gas powered saw. Keep the bar and chain oiled, and start the saw before touching the limb. Also, don't rush the cut, and take care not to get the bar in a bind, especially with the extension poles attached. I had my doubts about a battery powered chain saw, but this unit dispelled those quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of tree triming
customer_reviews.text: Great machine!!!!! Been cleaning up my trees in yard. All the way in size to 2". Have used it ever since the first day I got it. BATTERY LIFE IS GOOD. Some days it outlasts me! If you read the instructions and follow cutting procedures yo will have no problems. Due to vibration and use, it is a good idea to check and tighten pole sections if need be and check blade tightness.. DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN!!! Overall I am satisfied . Sure beats standing up on a latter Makes cleaning up the trees a breeze. At a great price to. Black&Decker has always been of good quality, am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Elrod

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The saw came in less than 48 hrs. I tried it w the extension and without. Both ways it grab the limbs and did its job. Lightweight and easy to use. I tried it on oak tree w limbs about 3". No problem. Don't forget to oil the chain prior to each use. Loved that the saw cover has a oil can and tool wrench holders. 20v did the job. I used one battery and it had enough power to finish my multiple test cuts. Definitely a buy for around the home use.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel  Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Versatile little chainsaw for home use. Simple to fix chain when it comes off...adjust two bolts with the included Allen wrench. Recommend buying an extra battery if you have a lot of work. This saw cut through 6” branches surprisingly well so I don’t need to buy a separate chainsaw for minimal usage. Be patient, it’s not gas powered so it is naturally a slower cut. I like the ease of maintenance using electric vs gas...just make sure you buy chain oil
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A real chainsaw on a pole that runs on Interchangeable batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This is a real chainsaw on a pole. I’ve cut branches up to 4 inches in diameter. I now have 4 B&D tools that use the same rechargeable batteries, so I always have batteries ready. Good system. The one awkward part: to extend the pole, you take the pole apart, screw in a center section.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Works well, considering its battery powered
customer_reviews.text: It's good for light duty- it's not going to cut down tree's, its not going to do super duty hard work. It will do light duty- I used it to remove a small copse of tree's about 10 feet long, 3 feet wide, and the widest tree was about 4" thick. The battery went flat at the 1/2 job point. Using it in the shortest position- sideways near the ground- given time you'll think your arms are being pulled out of their sockets if you're not used to heavy work. But it does the job- just not quickly. It does the job- just not like a gas engine would. But it DOES the job if you're not in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a little back yard like mine. I have 20 trees that need pruning every year and this works great. I typically use 2 batteries worth of energy to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Your Welcome

customer_reviews.title: OK this system ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty much the whole system (minus the hedge trimmer) and these tools and the 20v lithium battery system rocks. I own approximately 45 acres with lots, I MEAN LOTS of trees and a 1800' driveway ( which is of course lined with trees) so I have a lot of limb maintenance to do, this tool is the best tool I have ever seen for taking care of low hanging limbs. I have 3 batteries and a high speed charger ( only way to go) and they get used a lot between the leaf blowers (I have two), weed whacker, and drill, its working all the time. Anyway great system. Best regards,
customer_reviews.author: Troglodyte

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: i used just one extension. great! lightweight. easy to use for a lady who likes to garden. i recharged the batteries 3 times today. i got the bottom 'fluff' off about 6 trees before i needed to re-charge~ and we have new construction so there is a lot of fluff. i was surprised how large of a limb i could cut. i'll do about $350 worth of work just this one time using it! good deal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Pole Saw, 8-Inch (LPP120)
product_meta.description: Style:20V Pole Saw KitThe BLACK+DECKER Bare 20V MAX Lithium Ion Pole Pruning Saw is an excellent tool, designed for pruning overhead tree branches up to 14ft high. This bare tool is compatible with 20V MAX Lithium Ion battery which provides with a longer lifespan and 5X longer charge than similar NiCd batteries. It has an 8" cutting bar and chain that allows for a maximum cutting diameter of 6". The center extension allows For a useable length of 6.5' or 10' and provides overhead reach of up to 14 feet. This unit also features an in line power head allows easy maneuverability and visibility between branches. Unit disassembles for easy transport. Perfect for transporting to the worksite. The lightweight design makes it easy to use. Included Components: 1 20V MAX* Pole Saw with Extension, 1 20V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery, 20V MAX* Smart Battery Charger, Blade Guard Oil Bottle and Wrench
feature_bullets: Provides up to 100 cuts of 1 1/2 inches pine branches per charge
8" cutting bar & chain allows for a maximum cutting diameter of 6"
Includes 1 high capacity 20V LI ion pack, charger, oil bottle & wrench

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,744 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
